intro: Streblacanthus monospermus, commonly known as the single-seeded streblacanthus, is a rare flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring a single seed enclosed within a fleshy, berry-like fruit. Native to specific regions in tropical Africa, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant exhibits a short stature, typically growing no taller than 30 centimeters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
